medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message and to transmit the identifying number.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify related date/time.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information related to the whole message. In computer-to-computer exchanges free form text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segment.name: Control total
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CNT, A segment to provide message control totals.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group to provide information on the document being acknowledged.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment to provide the necessary identification information about the document being acknowledged.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to provide the relevant dates concerning the document being acknowledged.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to specify the document/message to which the current message relates, and related date and time.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to indicate the reference number of the document/message.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date and time of the referenced document/message.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify the identifications of message sender and message receiver with their contacts and communication channels.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the identification of the message issuer and message receiver.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to specify a person or department inside the party's organization, to which communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment to indicate communication channel type and number inside the party's organization, to which communication should be directed.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify the application error(s) within a specified received message and to give specific details related to the error type or to precise the type of acknowledgement.

medi:segment.name: Application error information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ERC, A segment identifying the type of application error or acknowledgement within the referenced message. In case of an error, the error code may specify the error in detail (e.g. a measurement relating to a piece of equipment is wrong) or as a rough indication (e.g. a measurement is wrong).

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment to provide explanation and/or supplementary information related to the specified application error or acknowledgement. For example, the explanation may provide exact details relating to a generic error code.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify the functional entity reference (e.g. goods item level, equipment level) relating to the specified error; further details can be added to identify the error more precisely.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to provide a reference relating to the acknowledgement type or the specified error (e.g. functional entity reference such as equipment level).

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment to provide additional details relating to the reference, e.g. the content of the wrong data (and its exact place in the message).
